person.persName: Samuel Thomas Hauser, Sr. (Pendleton County, Kentucky, attorney and county judge)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Bethania, North Carolina, native. Married to Mary Ann Kennett Hauser in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on March 21, 1822. Father of Samuel T. Hauser, Jr., Emeline Hauser, Theodosia Hauser, Henry D. Hauser, and Richard D. Hauser. Attorney in Pendleton County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1850. Presiding judge of the Pendleton County Court in Falmouth in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1860. Presiding judge of the Pendleton County Court in Falmouth in 1864.
